, and others.  In Yerevan, they leave from the central bus station, usually referred to as the Kilikia Bus Station.

Taxis could also be taken from the boarder with
.  The common fare for a taxi is AMD100 per kilometer, though taxis will try to prey on visitors lack of knowledge.
Taxis wait for fares near the bus station, just up the stairs.  They will speak
as well.  The standard fare is AMD100 per kilometer.
There are two beautiful but difficult to reach monastery nearby.

There are several cafes in town.  They do not usually serve food, but will go and buy something at a store if you ask.  If you want food, there is a horavats(grill) restaurant on the road south of town before you reach the next village.  The taxi fare should be AMD500, the minimum fare.
There are several cafes in town.  There you can find soft drinks, Armenia (Turkish) style coffee, beers, vodka, and brandy (called cognac).
There are currently two hotels in Noyemberyan and an third is being constructed.
